Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk devtoolset-3-strace
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: new packages: devtoolset-3-strace
Vulnerability.Description:
New devtoolset-3-strace packages are now available as part of Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.0 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. The strace program intercepts and records the system calls that are made and received by a running process and prints a record of each system call, its arguments, and its return value to standard error output or a file. It is often used for problem diagnoses, debugging, and for instructional purposes. The devtoolset-3-strace packages provide the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of strace.
This enhancement update adds the devtoolset-3-strace packages to Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.0 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. These packages include strace 4.8, which is the latest stable release of strace. It provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the version included in Red Hat Developer Toolset 2.1, including improvements in the decoding of system-call arguments and the addition of missing system calls. Additionally:
* When writing its output to a pipe, strace now waits for the pipe process to terminate before strace itself exits. * A new option, "-e trace=memory", has been added. It instructs strace to trace system calls related to memory mapping, allocation, deallocation, and management. * A new option, "-qq", has been added. It instructs strace to suppress messages about process exit status. (BZ#1096174)
All users who require devtoolset-3-strace are advised to install these new packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
